why_use_cookies.title: WHY DO WE USE COOKIES?
why_use_cookies.content:
To ensure that the website works properly and that you have an optimal user experience.
   	  	  To understand the number of visitors to our site and the pages they view.
   	  	  To make it possible to integrate social media on the website.
   	  	  To generate ads tailored to your needs.

what_is_cookies.title: WHAT IS A COOKIE?
what_is_cookies.content:
A cookie is a simple small file that is sent along with pages from this website and stored by the browser on your computer's 
   	  	  hard drive. The information stored therein can be sent back to our servers on a subsequent visit. A cookie is a file 
   	  	  containing an ID (a string of letters and numbers) that is sent by a web server to a web browser and stored by the browser. 
   	  	  The identifier is then sent back to the server each time the browser requests a page from the server. Cookies are small 
   	  	  pieces of data stored in a visitor's browser. They are usually used to track what settings users have selected and what 
   	  	  actions they have taken on a site.
   	  	  
   	  	  Cookies cannot be used to identify individuals, a cookie can only identify a machine. Cookies generally do not contain any 
   	  	  information that personally identifies a user, but personal information that we store about you may be linked to the 
   	  	  information stored in and obtained through cookies.

use_of_permanent_cookies.title: Use of permanent cookies
use_of_permanent_cookies.content:
With the help of a permanent cookie we can recognize you when you visit our website again. The website can therefore be 
   	  	  specially set to your preferences. Even if you have given permission for the placement of cookies, we can remember this by
   	  	   means of a cookie. As a result, you do not have to repeat your preferences every time, which saves you time and allows 
   	  	  you to use our website more pleasantly. Persistent cookies are stored by a web browser and remain valid until the set 
   	  	  expiry date, unless deleted by the user before the expiry date via your browser settings.

use_of_session_cookies.title: Use of session cookies
use_of_session_cookies.content:
A session cookie expires at the end of the user session when the web browser is closed. They usually store information in
   	  	  the form of a session identifier that does not personally identify the user. With the help of a session cookie we can see 
   	     which parts of the website you have viewed during this visit. This allows us to adapt our service as much as possible to the
   	  	  surfing behavior of our visitors. These cookies are automatically deleted when you close your web browser.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics
google_analytics.content:
Through our website, a cookie is placed from the company Google, as part of the 'Analytics' service. We use this service to 
   	  	  keep track of and to get reports on how visitors use the website. Google may provide this information to third parties if 
   	  	  Google is legally obliged to do so, or insofar as third parties process the information on behalf of Google. We have no 
   	  	  influence on this. We have not allowed Google to use the obtained analytics information for other Google services.
   	  	  
   	  	  The information that Google collects is anonymized as much as possible. Your IP address is emphatically not given. The 
   	  	  information is transferred to and stored by Google on servers in the United States. Google claims to adhere to the Safe 
   	  	  Harbor principles and is affiliated with the Safe Harbor program of the US Department of Commerce. This means that 
   	  	  there is an appropriate level of protection for the processing of any personal data.

right_to_access.title: Right to access and correct or delete your data
right_to_access.content:
You have the right to request access to and correction or deletion of your data. In order to prevent misuse, we may ask you 
   	  	  to identify yourself adequately. When it comes to accessing personal data linked to a cookie, you must send a copy of the 
   	  	  cookie in question. You can find these in the settings of your browser.
   	  	  
   	  	  You can send your question using the contact details which can be found on our Privacy Statement.

dftt.name: DFTT_END_USER_PREV_BOOTSTRAPPED
dftt.purpose:
It tells Tokized that we've already created a record for 
   	  	  	  	  	  	  this site visitor so it doesn't require any work and it 
   	  	  	  	  	  	  saves us some time loading. Tokized classifies these 
   	  	  	  	  	  	  cookies of the Functionality type.

xsrf_token.name: XSRF_TOKEN
xsrf_token.purpose:
This cookie contains a unique ID that links to the
   	  	  	  	  	  	  user's session information in your database. The browser delivers this cookie on future requests and the server knows who you are.

__gads.name: __gads
__gads.purpose:
The purpose of this cookie is to measure interactions 
   	  	  	  	  with the ads on that domain and to prevent the same 
   	  	  	  	  ads from being shown to you too often. These 
   	  	  	  	  cookies cannot be read by Google when you are on a 
   	  	  	  	  site other than the one on which they are placed.

__hssc.name: __hssc
__hssc.purpose:
This cookie keeps track of the sessions. This is used 
   	  	  	  	  to determine if we should increment the session 
   	  	  	  	  number and timestamps in the __hstc cookie. It 
   	  	  	  	  contains the domain, viewCount (increments every 
   	  	  	  	  page in a session) and session start timestamp.

__hssrc.name: __hssrc
__hssrc.purpose:
When HubSpot changes the session cookie, this 
   	  	  	  	  cookie is also set. We set it to 1 and use it to 
   	  	  	  	  determine if the visitor has restarted their browser. 
   	  	  	  	  If this cookie does not exist when we manage 
   	  	  	  	  cookies, we will assume it is a new session.

__hstc.name: __hstc
__hstc.purpose:
The main cookie for visitor tracking. It contains the 
   	  	  	  	  domain, utk (see below), initial timestamp (first visit), 
   	  	  	  	  last timestamp (last visit), current timestamp (this 
   	  	  	  	  visit), and session number (incremented for each 
   	  	  	  	  subsequent session).

__utma.name: __utma
__utma.purpose:
This cookie keeps track of how many times a visitor 
   	  	  	  	  has been to the site in relation to the cookie, when 
   	  	  	  	  their first visit was and when their last visit took 
   	  	  	  	  place. Google Analytics uses the information from 
   	  	  	  	  this cookie to calculate things like Days and Visits to
   	  	  	  	   buy.

__ga.name: __ga
__ga.purpose:
The customer ID is stored in the Google Analytics 
   	  	  	  	  cookie. The GA cookie is set when a person first 
   	  	  	  	  visits your website. Google Analytics sends the client 
   	  	  	  	  ID along with each hit to associate hits with a user. 
   	  	  	  	  The GA cookie can only exist on the device and 
   	  	  	  	  browser where it is set.

__utmx.name: __utmx
__utmx.purpose:
These Google Analytics cookies are used to engage 
   	  	  	  	  users in Content Experiments.

hubspotutk.name: hubspotutk
hubspotutk.purpose:
This cookie is used to keep track of a visitor's identity. 
   	  	  	  	  This cookie is passed to HubSpot when submitting 
   	  	  	  	  forms and is used when deduplicating contacts.

_fbc.name: _fbc
_fbc.purpose:
This Facebook cookie is only set if the user has 
   	  	  	  	  landed on our page with a fbclid URL parameter. It 
   	  	  	  	  will contain a click ID to be used to track Facebook 
   	  	  	  	  Pixel events back to the Facebook click.

_fbp.name: _fbp
_fbp.purpose:
Used by Facebook to deliver a range of advertising

   	  	  	  	  Targeting/Advertising

_gcl_au.name: _gcl_au
_gcl_au.purpose:
Used by Google AdSense to experiment with 
   	  	  	  	  advertising efficiency on websites using their 
   	  	  	  	  services.

_gid.name: _gid
_gid.purpose:
Registers a unique ID that is used to generate 
   	  	  	  	  statistical data about how the visitor uses the 
   	  	  	  	  website.

_hjid.name: _hjid
_hjid.purpose:
Hotjar cookie: This cookie is set when the customer 
   	  	  	  	  first lands on a page with the Hotjar script. It is used
   	  	  	  	   to maintain the Hotjar User ID unique to that site on
   	  	  	  	   the browser. This ensures that the behavior is 
   	  	  	  	  attributed to the same user ID on subsequent visits to
   	  	  	  	   the same site.

_hjptid.name: _hjptid
_hjptid.purpose:
Hotjar cookie: This cookie is set when the customer 
   	  	  	  	  first lands on a page with the Hotjar script. It is used 
   	  	  	  	  to maintain the Hotjar User ID unique to that site on
   	  	  	  	   the browser. This ensures that the behavior is 
   	  	  	  	  attributed to the same user ID on subsequent visits 
   	  	  	  	  to the same site.

ajs_anonymous_id.name: ajs_anonymous_id
ajs_anonymous_id.purpose:
These cookies are generally used for Analytics and 
   	  	  	  	  help count the number of people visiting a particular 
   	  	  	  	  site by tracing whether you've been there before. 
   	  	  	  	  This cookie has a lifespan of 1 year.

ajs_group_id.name: ajs_group_id
ajs_group_id.purpose: This Analytics cookie gives you a unique group ID.

ajs_user_id.name: ajs_user_id
ajs_user_id.purpose: This Analytics cookie gives you a unique user ID.

c_user.name: c_user
c_user.purpose:
The c_user cookie contains the user ID of the 
   	  	  	  	  currently logged in user. … If the 'keep me logged 
   	  	  	  	  in' checkbox is set, the cookie will expire after 90
   	  	  	  	   days of inactivity. If the 'keep me logged in' 
   	  	  	  	  checkbox is not set, the cookie is a session cookie 
   	  	  	  	  and will be deleted when the browser is closed.

datr.name: datr
datr.purpose:
The purpose of this cookie is to identify the web 
   	  	  	  	  browser used to connect to Facebook, regardless of 
   	  	  	  	  the logged in user. This cookie plays an important 
   	  	  	  	  role in Facebook's security and integrity features.

fr.name: fr
fr.purpose:
Used by Facebook to deliver a range of advertising 
   	  	  	  	  products, such as real-time bidding from third-party

intercom_session.name: intercom session

laravel_cookie_consent.name: laravel_cookie_consent

anabling_disabling_cookie.title: Enabling and disabling cookies and their removal
anabling_disabling_cookie.content:
You can set your internet browser in such a way that cookies are not accepted, that you receive a warning when a cookie 
   	  	  is installed or that the cookies are subsequently removed from your hard drive. More information about enabling, disabling 
   	  	  and deleting cookies can be found in the instructions and/or using the Help function of your browser.
   	  	  
   	  	  In most browsers you can refuse cookies and also delete existing cookies. The methods for doing this vary from browser to 
   	  	  browser and version to version. Keep in mind that certain graphic elements may not appear correctly, or that you will not 
   	  	  be able to use certain applications.
   	  	  
   	  	  You can obtain current information about blocking and deleting cookies via these links:
   	  	  
   	  	  (a)  https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?hl=en  (Chrome);
   	  	  
   	  	  (b)  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enable-and-disable-cookies-website-preferences  (Firefox);
   	  	  
   	  	  (c)  http://www.opera.com/help/tutorials/security/cookies/  (Opera);
   	  	  
   	  	  (d)  https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/17442/windows-internet-explorer-delete-manage-cookies  (Internet 
   	  	  Explorer);
   	  	  
   	  	  (e)  https://support.apple.com/kb/PH21411  (Safari); and
   	  	  
   	  	  (f)  https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10-microsoft-edge-and-privacy  (Edge).

faqs.content: Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum are powered by a technology called the blockchain. At its most basic, a blockchain is a list of transactions that anyone can view and verify. The Bitcoin blockchain, for example, contains a record of every time someone sent or received bitcoin. Cryptocurrencies and the blockchain technology that powers them make it possible to transfer value online without the need for a middleman like a This means their accuracy is constantly being verified by a huge amount of computing power. The list of transactions contained in the blockchain is fundamental for most cryptocurrencies because it enables secure payments to be made between people who don’t know each other without having to go through a third-party verifier like a bank. Due to the cryptographic nature of these networks, payments via blockchain can be more secure than standard debit/credit card transactions. When making a Bitcoin payment, for instance, you don’t need to provide any sensitive information. That means there is almost zero risks of your financial information being compromised, or your identity being stolen. Blockchain technology is also exciting because it has many uses beyond cryptocurrency. Blockchains are being used to explore medical research, improve the accuracy of healthcare records, streamline supply chains, and so much more. What are some advantages of blockchains? They’re global: which means that cryptocurrencies can be sent across the planet quickly and cheaply. They increase privacy: Cryptocurrency payments don’t require you to include your personal information, which protects you from being hacked or having your identity stolen. They’re open: Because every single transaction on cryptocurrency networks is published publicly in the form of the blockchain, anyone can scrutinize them. That leaves no room for manipulation of transactions, changing the money supply, or adjusting the rules mid-game. The software that constitutes the core of these currencies is free and open-source so anyone can review the code. How does blockchain work? Picture a chain you might use for a ship’s anchor. But in this case, every link on the chain is a chunk of information that contains transaction data. At the top of the chain, you see what happened today, and as you

New.thirdHeadingSubTitle:
For a complete and correct overview of the risks, we refer to our general terms and conditions and the 
  	 	information note for investors.

column_1._1_column_1:
##What if there are major costs or repairs?##
  The repairs are monitored by the independent manager 
  of the property. The costs of the works are finally 
  deducted from the rental income.
column_1._2_column_1:
##What if the property is not rented out?##
  Then the manager will do everything possible to get the 
  property back rented out as soon as possible. An 
  independent broker will look for a tenant. As long as the 
  property is not rented out, as a token holder you will not 
  receive any income
column_1._3_column_1:
##What information do I receive as an investor?##
  Tokized ensures that Token Holders are informed about, 
  among other things, the following:
  	 	 	 	 
  * Information from the Manager, such as changes in the 
  lease contracts, repairs…;
  	 	 	 	 
  * Relevant information about the Real Estate;
  	 	 	 	 
  * Possible changes to the Platform; and
  	 	 	 	 
  * Invitations to meetings, including the Extraordinary 
  General Meeting of Token Holders.
column_1._4_column_1:
##How many Tokized can I buy?##
  There is no limit on the investment amount or quantity. 
  Go ahead!

column_2._1_column_2:
##What if I want to sell my Tokized?##
  That's perfectly possible! You can sell your Tokized to 
  whoever you want. This can be to friends or family, or
  to other investors in the property. Currently, sales are 
  only possible to Belgians. This will be expanded in the 
  future.
column_2._2_column_2:
##When will it be decided to sell the property back?##A fixed end date is set for each property. Every 5 years 
  we organize a poll with all token holders. It can then be 
  decided with an 80% majority to sell the property early.
column_2._3_column_2:
##What if there are minor costs or repairs?##These are carried out by an independent steward, who 
  negotiates the best possible prices. The costs of the 
  works are deducted from the rental income.
column_2._4_column_2:
##Where can I track my investments? ##You can easily track your investments via the 'my 
  portfolio' button. On each building detail you will find 
  more information about the exploitation of that building.

column_1._1_column_1:
##Do I have to pay taxes on my Tokized income?##
  
  	 	 	From a fiscal point of view, the income from your Tokized 
  	 	 	consists of 2 components. A 'repayment component' 
  	 	 	and an 'interest' component. On the interest component 
  	 	 	you pay withholding tax that contains Tokized and 
  	 	 	transfers it for you. As a private individual, you do not 
  	 	 	have to indicate this further.
column_1._2_column_1:
##When will the rental income be paid?##
  	 
  You can find the payout times in the information note of 
  each property, which you can consult on the property
  detail page. In principle, 6-monthly rental income is
  paid out.

column_2._3_column_2:
##How much rental income will I actually receive?##


Every 6 months, the manager will communicate a report containing
an overview of the rental income and costs received. The difference is paid between the owners.

column_1._1_column_1:
##Risks related to the return and added value##
  
  If there is no rental income, you will not receive any 
  return as an investor. If the rental income is lower than 
  expected, you will receive a lower return as an investor.
  If the property is eventually sold, it may be for a lower 
  amount than the original purchase value.
column_1._2_column_1:
##Bankruptcy Risks##
  	 
  There is a risk that, as a result of the bankruptcy of the
  Issuer, the Token Holders would not be able to recover 
  the amounts to which they are entitled.
column_1._3_column_1:
##Risks related to the liquidity and value of the Tokized.##
  	 
  Tokized does not organize a market to trade Tokized 
  between themselves. You can of course always sell 
  yourself to acquaintances or via forums. This limits 
  liquidity.
  	 	 	 
  Ultimately, the property is always sold back, so you get 
  your part of the sales value back.

column_2._1_column_2:
##Risks associated with economic crises.##
  
  The risk of rent arrears or vacancy generally increases 
  during economic or health crises.
column_2._2_column_2: Risks associated with the change in financial regulation or supervisory position It is possible that the issuance of Tokized will be subject to stricter or modified regulations in the future, or the competent supervisory authority will revise its position in this regard. In that case, Tokized may incur costs to comply, which may affect the Revenue.
column_2._3_column_2:
##Real estate risks##
  	 
  Real estate obsolete with the years. It is therefore 
  possible that additional investments are necessary, 
  which, if necessary, will be recovered from the rental 
  income.
  	 	 	 
  Other risks may include, but are not limited to, soil 
  contamination, expropriation, asbestos, natural 
  disasters, war, terror, other calamities and uncovered 
  damage or costs by fire or other insurers.
  	 	 	 
  However, a thorough due diligence is carried out before 
  the purchase of the Property to avoid these matters.

column_1._1_column_1:
##Is there a difference between token holders?##
  
  The Tokized Offered have the same rank ( pari passu ).
column_1._2_column_1:
##How is the sales result calculated?## In the liquidation of the Tokized, the difference between on the one hand: 1. The proceeds of Transfer of the Real Estate; 2. Any rental income that has not yet been paid; and 3. The proceeds from the sale of the Issuer's other assets;and otherwise: 1. The reasonable costs associated with the Transfer of the Property, including customary brokerage fees and any other costs that might be incurred by the Issuer. These costs are calculated at 3.0% on top of the broker's salary who is appointed upon the Real Estate Transfer;
2. The reasonable costs, interests, fees and capital repayments of the bank loans, if any, entered into for the benefit of the Real Estate;
3. All tax charges, insofar as they are due as a result of the Transfer of the Real Estate or when setting up the operation;
4. The paid-up equity of the Issuer;
5. The other debts and trade debts, with the exception of the booked claim of the Token Holders;
6. An amount that allows to pay the corporate income tax and other possible taxes and levies owed by the Issuer in connection with the Tokized ERC 20 Tokens and the Real Estate; and
7. Any other reasonable costs not yet charged;
column_1._3_column_1:
##Who supervises Tokized?##
  	 
  	 	 	Tokized is not a regulated or licensed company. 
  	 	 	Nevertheless, the FSMA will supervise the Issuer in 
  	 	 	order to guarantee a sufficient degree of investor 
  	 	 	protection. The investor is also advised that the Issuer 
  	 	 	will not or cannot provide Investment Advice in 
  	 	 	connection with the issuance or purchase of the 
  	 	 	Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens.
column_1._4_column_1:
##What are Tokized legally?##
  	 
  The Offered Tokized (full term is Tokized ERC 20 Token) are 
  “tokenized” debt instruments that incorporate rights to 
  the income, proceeds and realization value of the real 
  estate determined at the time of issue. An Tokized ERC 
  20 Token is not a bond: the return is not fixed and can 
  only be paid out if there is sufficient (rental) income. 
  Nor is there any capital guarantee at maturity. The 
  Token Holders will be reimbursed on the transfer of the
  Real Estate solely on the basis of their share of the sale 
  price.
  	 	 	 
  The Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are created via DLT.
  In particular, each transaction with an Offered Immo 
  Token forms a block on a Chromia blockchain, and the 
  Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens can be traded on this 
  blockchain.
  	 	 	 
  The Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are subject to 
  respective rights and obligations which are set out in
  the Issuance Conditions and which each Token Holder 
  must commit to before being able to subscribe to the 
  Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens. The rights and 
  obligations remain attached to the Offered Tokized ERC 
  20 Tokens, in whatever hands they pass.
  	 	 	 
  The Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered are indivisible.

column_2._1_column_2:
##Is a prospectus being written for the issuance of Tokized?##
  
  An information note is issued for each issue of Tokized. 
  This document is not a prospectus and is not reviewed 
  or approved by the Financial Services and Markets 
  Authority.
column_2._2_column_2:
##What costs are for the investor?##
  	 
  The costs relating to the Real Estate are charged or 
  passed on to the Token Holders, including, among other 
  things: the remuneration of the management controller, 
  the real estate tax and other basic charges, the costs 
  relating to the Platform, the insurances, the capital cost 
  of the Issuer , etc.)
column_2._3_column_2:
##How is the operating result calculated?##
  	 
  The amount to be distributed annually in respect of the
  Issuer's financial year, which consists of the difference 
  between, on the one hand:
  	 	 	 
  1. The entirety of the rental income of the Real Estate;
  2. The proceeds from all temporary investments related 
     to the real estate operation;
  3. The other receipts insofar as they relate to the
  	Immovable Property, such as default interest, all kinds 
  	of indemnities, recognition of unspent provisions and 
  	revenues of any nature whatsoever relating to the
  	Immovable Property;
  	and otherwise:
  	 	 	 
  1. The reasonable costs, fees, fees, costs of repairs and 
  	all kinds of provisions at the expense of the Issuer with
  	regard to (i) the Real Estate, (ii) the activity of the 
  	Issuer in its capacity as owner or issuer of the Tokized 
  	ERC 20 Tokens including the operation of the 
  	Platform, and/or (ii) activities of the Manager. These 
  	costs are calculated at 3% of the gross rental income;
  2. The reasonable costs, interests and capital 
  	repayments of the bank loans or other financing, if 
  	necessary, entered into for the benefit of the Real 
  	Estate;
  3. Any deduction to form a provision for future 
  	maintenance and repair costs. The amount is fixed by 
  	the Issuer and subject to approval by the Management 
  	Controller;
  4. Reasonable costs related to the real estate appraiser's
  	fee, accounting costs as well as all possible costs of 
  	experts;
  5. An amount that allows to pay the corporate income 
  	tax and other possible taxes or levies owed by the 
  	Issuer in connection with the Tokized ERC 20 Tokens or 
  	the Real Estate; and
  6. Costs related to vacancy and neglect;

info.mainTitle: INFORMATION NOTE ABOUT THE OFFER OF “ Tokized ERC 20 Tokens” BY  Tokized REAL ESTATE LLC
info._1_paragraph:
This document has been prepared by  Tokized Real Estate LLC.
  
  	THIS DOCUMENT IS NOT A PROSPECTUS AND HAS NOT BEEN REVIEWED NOR APPROVED BY THE FINANCIAL 
  	SERVICES AND MARKETS AUTHORITY.
  	 
  	August 15, 2021
  	 
  	WARNING: THE INVESTOR RISES TO LOSE ALL OR PART OF THEIR INVESTMENT AND/OR NOT TO REACH THE 
  	EXPECTED RETURN.
  	 
  	THE INVESTMENT INSTRUMENTS ARE NOT LISTED: THE INVESTOR RUNS THE RISK OF HAVING MAJOR PROBLEMS 
  	OF SELLING HIS POSITION TO A THIRD PARTY IF THEY WISH TO DO SO.
info._2_paragraph:
##Part I. – Main risks inherent in the issuer and the investment instruments offered, and specific to the offer concerned
  
  	 *Risk factors associated with  Tokized Real Estate A BV (hereinafter the “Issuer”)
  	 *Preliminary remark##
info._3_paragraph:
The Issuer is a private limited company under Belgian law whose main objective is the securitization of real estate in order 
  	to allow investors to invest indirectly in real estate.
  	 
  	The Issuer achieves this objective by raising capital from the public in order to acquire real estate with a view to letting 
  	and transferring it. The capital is raised, among other things, through the issuance of “tokenized” debt instruments (the “  
  	Tokized ERC 20 Tokens ”).
  	 
  	Through these  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens, potential investors (the “ Token Holders ”) are offered an opportunity to invest in real 
  	estate. Although various options have been offered in Belgium for several decades to invest indirectly in real estate, the  
  	Tokized ERC 20 Tokens offered in the context of this issue (the “ Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens ”) are the first debt 
  	instruments to be issued in the form of tokens created through Distributed Ledger Technology (hereinafter “ DLT ”). DLT is 
  	a type of technology that supports the capture of encrypted data in a distributed ledger .
  	 
  	The structure of this offer is as follows: Issuer property (the " Property ") acquired / in the near future a property (the "
  	  Property ") purchases]. One series of  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens will be issued for this Real Estate, namely the Offered  Tokized 
  	ERC 20 Tokens. The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered therefore relate exclusively to the Real Estate. Any subsequent 
  	issuance of  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens by the Issuer will always relate to a different real estate and will be strictly separated 
  	from the present issue / the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens.
info._4_paragraph:
##*Risks related to the Issuer's business
  	 *Risks associated with the concentration of the investment##
info._5_paragraph:
The profits related to the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens depend solely on the annual rental income and/or realized capital 
  	gains arising from the sale of the Real Estate (jointly the “ Revenues ”), which entails a concentration risk. Any (temporary) 
  	reduction or absence of rental income or a realized loss in value is also exclusively borne by the investors who have 
  	subscribed to the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens. Consequently, the income and risks of different real estate are not 
  	pooled.
  	 
  	The concentration risk mentioned above means, among other things, that if the rental income is disappointing, this may 
  	have an adverse effect on the return of the  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens on offer. If the sale of the Real Estate is accompanied by 
  	a loss in value, for example as a result of a general decrease in real estate prices, each Token Holder can only claim a pro
  	  rata part of the sale proceeds.
  	 
  	Under no circumstances can the Issuer be held liable for disappointing Proceeds.
info._6_paragraph:
##*Risks associated with a possible insolvency of the Issuer##
  	There is a risk that, as a result of the bankruptcy of the Issuer, the Token Holders would not be able to recover the 
  	amounts to which they are entitled. In principle, it cannot be excluded that the Issuer is unable to fulfill its obligations.
info._7_paragraph:
##*Risks associated with real estate
  	 *Risks associated with the Real Estate##
info._8_paragraph:
Due to its nature, the Property may functionally and/or physically age, which may cause it to lose its attractiveness. In that 
  	case, additional investments may be necessary that may weigh on the Revenues.
  	 
  	Other risks may include, but are not limited to, the (complete or incomplete) destruction of the Property, soil 
  	contamination, expropriation, asbestos, natural disasters, war, terror, other calamities and uncovered damage or costs 
  	due to fire. - or other insurers. However, a due diligence [was/is] performed prior to the purchase of the Property.
info._9_paragraph:
##*Risks associated with construction activities in case of new construction##
  	The current offer relates to a property yet to be established. Incorporation may involve counterparty risks if contractors, 
  	subcontractors, suppliers, architects or other actors involved fail to meet their obligations.]
  	 
  	 ##*Risks associated with the cyclical nature of the real estate market##
  	The real estate market has a cyclical character, linked in particular to the general economic situation, interest rates and 
  	the expectations of the main actors with regard to economic growth and inflation. An economic slowdown, recession or 
  	crisis with a regional, national or international scope can have a negative impact on Revenue.
info._10_paragraph:
*Risks associated with the offer
  	 *Risks related to the limited liquidity and the value of the  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens
  	The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered are not listed and will not be listed on a regulated market or on an MTF (Multilateral 
  	Trading Facility). The Issuer does not organize a secondary market. Moreover, the  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered do not 
  	offer any protection against inflation or monetary erosion.
info._11_paragraph:
*Risks associated with the change in financial regulation or supervisory position
  	It is possible that the issuance of the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens will be subject to stricter or amended regulations in 
  	the future, or the competent supervisory authority will revise its position in this regard. In that case, the Issuer may incur 
  	costs to comply, which may affect the Revenues.
  	 
  	 *Risks associated with the COVID-19 pandemic and economic crisis
  	The current COVID-19 pandemic and the measures taken by the government can have an unpredictable impact on the real 
  	estate market and on Revenues. The risk of rent arrears or vacancy generally increases during economic or health crises.
  	 
  	 *Risks associated with using the website
  	Technical failures may occur when using the website where the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are offered, such as, but 
  	not limited to, login, purchase or registration problems, server overload, cyber attacks (e.g. hacking, phishing).

info._third_para_heading:
##C.      Description of the Underlying Asset 	  	  	  
  	  Part III. – Information on the offering of investment instruments 	  	  	  
  	  A.      Description of the offer 	  	  	  
  	  ##

1°.lifespan:
Offer Terms
  	 	 	 
  	 	 	 
  Minimum amount for which

  Minimum and/or maximum

1°.purpose:
Any natural or legal person established in Belgium can subscribe 
  to the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens in accordance with the 
  procedure laid down in the issuance conditions regarding the 
  Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens (the “ Issue Conditions ”).	 
  	 	 	 	 
  However, if less than 30% of the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens 
  is subscribed, the Issuer reserves the right to cancel the offer 
  and to refund the capital raised.	 
  
  Minimum subscription amount per investor: EUR 50, being 1 
  Offered Immo Token.

3°.lifespan:
Total price of the investment

3°.purpose: EUR 50 x # Offered Tokized ERC 20 Tokens = EUR Total Price

4°.lifespan:
Timetable of the offer: start 
  and closing date of the offer, 
  issue date of the investment 
  instruments
4°.purpose:
The subscription period runs from the issue of the information 
  note to the closing date. The offer will be closed early if the 
  maximum amount is reached before this date.	 
  	 	 	 
  If the minimum amount has not been reached on the closing 
  date, the offer period can be extended by a maximum of [six 
  (6)] months. Thereafter, the offer will be definitively closed 
  based on the amount raised (which must, however, be at least 
  equal to the minimum amount set).

5°.purpose:
The costs relating to the Real Estate are charged or passed on 
  to the Token Holders, including, among other things: the 
  remuneration of the management controller, the real estate 
  tax and other basic charges, the costs relating to the Platform,
  the insurances, the capital cost of the Issuer , etc.)	 
  	 	 	 
  	 	 	 	 
  The total annual costs are estimated per Offered Immo Token
  at the time of the information note.

1°.lifespan:
Description of the intended

1°.purpose:
The current offer aims to finance the purchase of the Real Estate. 
  The Property will be (i) leased for the purpose of generating a 
  return to the Token Holders in the form of rental income, after 
  settlement of the above costs, and (ii) sold in accordance with 
  the terms of the Issue Conditions, after which the Token 
  Holders will also be entitled to a proportional share of any 
  realized capital gain.

2°.lifespan:
Details of the financing of 
  the project that the offer 
  aims to realize

The current offer aims to finance the purchase of the Real 
  Estate. The Property will be (i) leased for the purpose of 
  generating a return to the Token Holders in the form of 
  rental income, after settlement of the above costs, and (ii) 
  sold in accordance with the terms of the Issue Conditions, 
  after which the Token Holders will also be entitled to a

info._fifth_para_heading:
Part IV. – Information about the investment instruments offered
## A.      Characteristics of the investment instruments offered##
##
##

1°.lifespan:
Nature and category of the 
  investment instruments
1°.purpose:
The Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are “tokenized” debt 
  instruments that incorporate rights to the income, proceeds 
  and realization value of the real estate determined at the 
  time of issue. An Immo Debt Token is not a bond: the return 
  is not fixed and can only be paid out if there is sufficient 
  (rental) income. Nor is there any capital guarantee at 
  maturity. The Token Holders will be reimbursed on the 
  transfer of the Real Estate solely on the basis of their share
  of the sale price.
  
  
  The Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are created via DLT. In 
  particular, each transaction with an Offered Immo Token forms 
  a block on a Chromia blockchain, and the Offered  Tokized ERC 
  20 Tokens can be traded on this blockchain.	 
  
  The Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens are subject to respective 
  rights and obligations which are set out in the Issuance 
  Conditions and which each Token Holder must commit to 
  before being able to subscribe to the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 
  Tokens. The rights and obligations remain attached to the 
  Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens, in whatever hands they pass.	 
  
  The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered are indivisible.

2°.purpose:
The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered are denominated in Euro, 
  bear the denomination “ Tokized ERC 20 Tokens” and each have
  a nominal value of EUR 50.

3°.lifespan:
Description of the intended 
  use of the collected amounts
3°.purpose:
The Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens have a fixed term of thirty 
  (30) years. They are partly repaid during the term in function
  of the depreciation of the Real Estate, and partly on the sale 
  of the Real Estate with regard to the part of the Real Estate 
  that has not yet been depreciated. However, the refunded 
  amount in the event of a sale depends on the realized sale 
  price.	 
  	 	 	 
  Be handovers are of the Property set at five (5), ten (10) and 
  fifteen (15) years from the date of issue, in accordance with 
  the decision of the Extraordinary General Meeting of Token 
  Holders (see infra Part V). Therefore, the Token Holders
  cannot decide at any time to proceed with the sale of the 
  Property.	 
  
  However, the Extraordinary General Meeting may, when an 
  exceptional opportunity arises, decide to transfer the Real 
  Estate outside these transfer moments (see infra part V).

4°.lifespan:
Rank of the investment 
  instruments in the capital 
  structure of the issuer in 
  the event of insolvency
4°.purpose:
The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered have the same ranking 
  ( pari passu ). The Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens do not grant 
  the Token Holders any priority or security.	 
  
  The rights of the Token Holders are subordinate to the rights 
  of secured creditors.	 
  
  The Token Holders have priority over the shareholders.

5°.lifespan:
Restrictions on the free 
  transfer of investment 
  instruments
5°.purpose:
The  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered are freely transferable. 
  However, a Token Holder who wishes to transfer his tokens
  is obliged to find a buyer himself. The Issuer will not and 
  can under no circumstances be deemed to bring two or 
  more investors into contact with each other as a result of
  which a transaction can be effected between these Token 
  Holders.

6°.purpose:
The Issuer provides an estimate of the gross rental yield and 
  capital gain per year at the time of the transfer of the Property.	 
  	 	 	 
  – Value of the Property invested in under this offer	 
  
  – Expected annual rental income	 
  
  – Expected costs on an annual basis

7°.lifespan:
Date on which the interest 
  rate is paid
7°.purpose:
The variable rental income on the Property is paid annually on 
  the first day of the month of June. If this day does not fall on a 
  working day, the payment will be made on the next working day.	 
  
  The Issuer nevertheless has the option of distributing the variable 
  rental income semi-annually, in which case it will be regarded as 
  an advance on the annual rental income to be distributed. This 
  advance will be settled when the annual variable rental income
  is paid on the above date.

info._13_paragraph:
##Part V. – Any other material information addressed orally or in writing to one or more investors
  
  	1. Meetings of Token Holders
  	1° Common provisions##
  	 
  	The meetings of Token Holders are chaired by the chairman of the board of directors of the Issuer or his deputy mandated 
  	by the board of directors. The chairman and a secretary designated by the latter form the bureau. Each Token Holder can 
  	be represented at the meeting by a proxy holder, whether or not a Token Holder. The board of directors of the Issuer may 
  	determine the form of the proxies.
info._14_paragraph:
2° Information meetings
  
  	An information meeting is held annually, ex officio and without notice, on the first Friday of February. If this day falls on a 
  	public holiday, the meeting will take place on the next working day. The meeting will be held digitally [via the Platform].
  	 
  	On this occasion, the board of directors will explain the accounts relating to the buildings and inform the meeting about 
  	all important elements related to the Real Estate and the  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens Offered.
info._15_paragraph:
3° Extraordinary General Meetings
  
  	In addition, the Issuer may, if it deems it necessary and at the sole initiative of the board of directors, convene an 
  	extraordinary general meeting of Token Holders, which may make decisions that are binding on all Token Holders. The 
  	Issuer invites the Token Holders via a notice on the Platform. The meeting will be held digitally [via the Platform].
  	 
  	The following decisions require the prior consent of the general meeting of Token Holder and in any case an extraordinary 
  	general meeting of Token Holders will be convened by the board of directors of the Issuer:
  	 *
  	The transfer of the Real Estate on one of the transfer moments, namely after five (5), ten (10) or fifteen (15) years from the 
  	issue date. Six (6) months before any or upcoming transfer time, the Token Holder will be notified of the Transfer Time and 
  	will be able to consent to the Transfer of the Property.
  	 *In case of unfavorable market conditions, including a fall in real estate prices, the transfer moment may be postponed by 
  	the Extraordinary General Meetings of Token Holders;
  	 
  	 *Exceptional opportunities to sell the Property outside the fixed transfer times, including the sale to a company belonging 
  	to the Issuer's group;
  	 *The possible extension or conversion of the Real Estate for an amount that is higher than 10% of its current sales value. 
  	Before such decision is made, the meeting of Token Holders must decide on its financing method. If the financing is done 
  	through a new issue of  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens, a preferential right is granted to the Token Holders. They may exercise this 
  	preferential subscription right during a period of fifteen (15) days from the date of opening of the subscription;
  	 *The appointment of a new management controller;
  	 *Reconstruction if the Real Estate is completely or partially destroyed;
  	 *The amendment of the issuance conditions of the  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens.
  	 *The extraordinary general meeting can only validly deliberate if the attendees represent at least half of the existing 
  	Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens. If this condition is not met, a new meeting is required. The second meeting must take 
  	place within the month following the first meeting and can deliberate regardless of the number of  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens 
  	on offer present or represented.
  	 
  	Each Immo Debt Token Offered is entitled to one vote. If the ownership of an Offered Immo Debt Token is divided 
  	between different persons, [the board of directors/the director] has the right to suspend the voting rights attached thereto 
  	until a single person has been designated as Token Holder in respect of the Issuer.
  	 
  	Any decision to amend the Issue Conditions is taken by a [four-fifths] majority of the votes cast. All other decisions may be
  	  taken by a [two-thirds/simple] majority of the votes cast. In all cases, abstentions are not included in either the numerator
  	  or the denominator.
info._16_paragraph:
##1. management controller##
  	  The Issuer will appoint a management controller to look after the interests of the Token Holders.
  	  
  	  The management controller has the following duties:
  	  
  	  * Approve the calculation of the operating result and the liquidation balance and make the necessary comments and 
  	  proposals in this regard. To this end, the Board of Directors of the Issuer will submit the calculation to the management 
  	  controller within the month following the closing of the financial year or the transfer of the Real Estate. The management 
  	  controller will draw up a report on the aforementioned calculation, within one month of its receipt, in which he expresses 
  	  his opinion on the merits of the transactions and his opinion on the correctness of the accounts;
  	  * Assess the Issuer's transactions and express its opinion on their merits, in particular with a view to informing Token 
  	  Holders.
  	  In particular, the assessment should cover:
  	  
  	  * The useful use of the funds and the destination of temporary investments;
  	  * Compliance for the various parties with the agreements regarding the acquisition, management and rental of the Real 
  	  Estate;
  	  * The justification for any renovation, repair or extension work;
  	  * The conditions for any transfer;
  	  * The convening of the extraordinary general meeting of Token Holders.
  	  * To provide advice to the board of directors of the Issuer if the conversion concerns 30% or less of the existing surface 
  	  area of ​​the Property;
  	  * Attending the extraordinary general meetings of the Token Holders with an advisory vote.
  	  In the performance of its duties, the management controller has the right to access all documents of the Issuer relating to 
  	  the distribution of the amounts due to the Token Holders. He may seek the advice of experts in special cases requiring 
  	  specific technical knowledge, if this does not entail unreasonable costs for the Issuer.
info._17_paragraph:
1. Tax treatment of the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens
  	  From a tax point of view, part of the payments made by the Issuer to the Token Holders constitute a redemption of the 
  	  amount subscribed. That part is not taxable in Belgium. The balance of the payments made by the Issuer to the Token 
  	  Holders represents a movable income and is in principle subject to withholding tax. However, no complete analysis is 
  	  provided here regarding all tax aspects related to the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens.
  	  
  	  Token holders should consult their own tax advisors with regard to the consequences of the tax laws applicable in their 
  	  state of citizenship, residence, habitual residence or domicile and of the tax laws of Belgium regarding the acquisition, 
  	  holding and transfer of the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens and obtaining interest payments, principal payments and/or 
  	  other amounts under the Offered  Tokized ERC 20 Tokens.

pol._2_paragraph:
General
  	Tokized is responsible for the processing of your personal data on the Platform.
  	 
  	Tokized complies with the 'Act of December 8, 1992 on the protection of privacy with regard to the processing of personal 
  	data', as amended by the Act of December 11, 1998, as well as the anti-spam provisions of Book XII of the Code of 
  	Economic Law regarding the “ law of the electronic economy”.
  	 
  	Tokized also complies with the European Regulation 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 on the protection of personal data by means 
  	of the current Privacy Policy.
pol._5_paragraph:
direct marketing
  	The personal data will also be used for direct marketing, provided you have given additional explicit permission for this 
  	 ("opt-in").
  	 
  	If you are already included in our mailing list for receiving marketing materials in paper and/or electronic form, Tokized may 
  	use your data to send marketing and other materials related to Tokized, its products and/or services. Tokized may use the data 
  	provided by you to update documents stored by Tokized.
  	 
  	This consent can be withdrawn at any time, without justification and free of charge, for example by clicking on the 
  	unsubscribe link provided for this purpose at the bottom of every promotional e-mail message.
pol._6_paragraph:
Transfer to third parties
  	In the event of a complete or partial reorganization or transfer of activities of Tokized, whereby it reorganizes, transfers, 
  	ceases its business activities or if Tokized goes bankrupt, this may mean that your data is given to new entities or third 
  	parties through which the business activities of Tokized are wholly or partially carried out. are transferred.
  	 
  	Tokized will make reasonable efforts to inform you in advance of the fact that Tokized will disclose your data to said third party, 
  	but you also acknowledge that this is not technically or commercially feasible under all circumstances.
  	 
  	Tokized will not sell, rent, distribute or otherwise make your Personal Data commercially available to third parties, except as 
  	described above or without your prior consent.
  	 
  	In rare cases, Tokized may be required to disclose your Personal Data pursuant to a court order or to comply with other 
  	mandatory laws or regulations. Tokized will make reasonable efforts to inform you about this in advance, unless this is 
  	subject to legal restrictions.
pol._7_paragraph:
##Duration of processing##
  	The personal data is stored and processed by us for a period that is necessary in function of the purposes of the 
  	processing and in function of the contractual relationship.
pol._8_paragraph:
Your rights
  	You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
  	 
  	Right of access and inspection: You have the right to take cognizance of your personal data at any time free of charge, as 
  	well as the use that We make of your personal data.
  	Right of correction, deletion and limitation: You are free to decide whether or not to communicate your personal data to 
  	Tokized. In addition, you always have the right to request us to correct, supplement or delete your personal data. You 
  	acknowledge that in case of refusal of communication or request for removal of personal data, certain services and 
  	products will not be available. You may also request that the processing of your Personal Data be restricted.
  	Right to object: You also have a right to object to the processing of your personal data for serious and legitimate reasons. 
  	In addition, you always have the right to object to the use of personal data for direct marketing purposes; in such a case 
  	you do not have to give reasons.
  	Right to withdraw consent: Insofar as the processing is based on your prior consent, you have the right to withdraw that 
  	consent.
  	You can exercise your rights by contacting us, either by e-mail to  info@Tokized.com
pol._9_paragraph:
Security and confidentiality
  	We have developed security measures that are adapted from a technical and organizational point of view to avoid the 
  	destruction, loss, falsification, modification, unauthorized access or incorrect notification to third parties of personal data 
  	collected as well as any other unauthorized processing of this information.
  	 
  	Under no circumstances can Tokized be held liable for any direct or indirect damage resulting from incorrect or unlawful 
  	use by a third party of the personal data.
  	 
  	You must comply with the security regulations at all times, including by preventing any unauthorized access to your login 
  	and code. You are therefore solely responsible for the use made of the Platform from your computer, IP address and 
  	identification data, as well as for their confidentiality.
pol._10_paragraph:
##Access by third parties##
  	In order to process your personal data, We grant access to your personal data to our employees. We guarantee a similar 
  	level of protection by making contractual obligations enforceable against these employees that are similar to this Privacy 
  	Policy.
pol._11_paragraph:
Cookies
  	What are cookies?
  	A “cookie” is a small file sent by the Tokized server and placed on your computer's hard drive. The information stored on 
  	these cookies can only be read by us and only for the duration of the visit to the Platform.
  	 
  	Why do we use cookies?
  	Our Website uses cookies and similar technologies to distinguish your usage preferences from those of other users of our 
  	Website. This helps us to provide you with a better user experience when you visit our Website and also allows us to 
  	optimize our Website.
  	 
  	Types of cookies
  	Although there are different types of cookies, differentiated in terms of functionality, origin or retention period, the 
  	legislation mainly distinguishes between functional or technically necessary cookies on the one hand and all other 
  	cookies on the other.
  	 
  	Tokized uses the following "functional or necessary" cookies for which your prior consent is not necessary:
  	 
  	 *Necessary cookies allow users to navigate through a website and use the functions of the website.
  	 *Functional cookies increase the user-friendliness of a website by remembering your choices (e.g. language preferences, 
  	region, login).
  	Tokized also uses the following cookies for which we do ask your prior consent:
  	 
  	 *Performance cookies collect data about the use of a website such as the number of visitors, the time visitors spend on a 
  	web page and error messages. We use Google Analytics (to collect anonymous data about how our website is used and 
  	to compile visitor statistics – How Google uses data when you use our partners' sites or apps).
  	 *Advertising cookies ensure that a website can send personalized advertising messages. Use our websites to provide 
  	DoubleClick (collects data about page viewing and advertisements, and can create a user profile. This is basically done 
  	anonymously unless the user identifies himself through his Google account).
  	For cookies placed by third parties (including Google Analytics), we would like to refer you to the statements that these 
  	parties provide on their respective websites. Please note: we have no influence whatsoever on the content of those 
  	statements, nor on the content of the cookies of these third parties.
pol._12_paragraph:
Your permission
  	On your first visit to our Website you will be asked to accept our different types of cookies. You can allow or refuse 
  	cookies category by category. You can change the cookie settings for our Website at any time via the hyperlink at the 
  	bottom of our website and thus withdraw your consent.
  	 
  	You can refuse the installation of these cookies by choosing "Refuse cookies" in the pop-up screen offered for the first 
  	time use of the Platform.
  	 
  	You can also refuse or block cookies by changing the configuration parameters of your navigation system. Disabling 
  	cookies may mean that you cannot use certain functionalities of the Platform.
  	 
  	You agree that Tokized has the right to post a script to detect ad blockers.

how.mainTitle:
From creating an account to your first investment. On this page 
  	we explain step by step how to invest in an Tokized for the first time.

_1_step.title: Registration
_1_step.description:
To gain access to the property details, we ask you to 
  register without obligation. You can register via the 
  'Register' button at the top right. After registration you 
  will receive a confirmation email. It can take up to 
  3 minutes before you receive the email. If you do not 
  receive it, send a message to info@Tokized.com

_2_step.title: Upload and ID card
_2_step.description:
To buy an Tokized you have to identify yourself. This can easily 
  be done by sending a photo or copy of your identity card. 
  We use this information to check your eligibility to purchase 
  Tokized.

_3_step.title:
Choose a 
  	 	property(s) to invest
_3_step.description:
Via the 'invest' button you get an overview of our available 
  properties. You can compare on type of property, return, 
  rental contracts, location… We ensure that all the 
  properties offered are of high quality, but you make the 
  final choice.

_4_step.title:
Read the
  	 	documentation carefully
_4_step.description:
We draw up an information note for each property. Read this 
  carefully, so you can invest with confidence. Further in the 
  process are the general and legal conditions. This 
  documentation is about the property itself.

_5_step.title:
Choose an 
  	 	investment amount
_5_step.description:
You are free to choose how much you invest with a minimum 
  of €50. There is no maximum amount.

_6_step.title:
Read & 
  	 	accept the terms
_6_step.description:
Read the general issuance conditions and registration 
  agreement and information note. You can also read the 
  most frequently asked questions in our FAQ.

_7_step.title:
Pay securely 
  	 	via Mollie
_7_step.description:
You are free to choose how much you invest with a minimum 
  of €50. There is no maximum amount.

_8_step.title: Success!
_8_step.description:
If everything went well, you are now the proud owner of your 
  new investment portfolio. You can find your investments 
  under 'my portfolio'.
  	 	 
  You will find a monthly update for each investment under 
  “documentation”.
  You will receive your share of the rental income every 6 
  months.
  You will also receive important communication about the 
  investment by e-mail.
